alert.note: Alert for Shannon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:49AM CST until December 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 947 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road, Carr Creek at Highway HH, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Rocky Creek at Highway NN, and South Prong of the Jacks Fork River at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain View, Willow Springs, Winona, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Pomona and Montier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
